title: s5i-n6o
author: s5i-n6o
content: Lately I have been reading a lot about the identity and the search for the person behind the pseudonym Satoshi Nakamoto. It has to be said that the person has given the world a new perspective with a very simple code and algorithm.When I look at the industry that has emerged from a simple algorithm, it seems enormous. To the point that it is still burning governments and unfortunately the SEC for the person behind the pseudonym Satoshi Nakamoto. Hence her and publicly in Satoshi Nakamoto's favourite forum, the opportunity to ask questions. Questions that have so far been waiting for an answer rather through the formation of myths? Questions about whatever? Also about Satoshi Nakamoto's upcoming projects?Ask! ----In der letzten Zeit habe ich sehr viel zur Identität und zur Suche nach der Person hinter dem Pseudonym Satoshi Nakamoto gelesen. Festzustellen ist, dass die Person mit einem sehr einfachen Code und Algorithmus, der Welt eine neue Perspektive gestiftet hat.Schaue ich auf die Industrie, die aus einem einfachen Algorithmus entstanden ist, scheint enorm zu sein. Bis dahin, dass sie Regierungen und leider immer noch die SEC für die Person hinter dem Pseudonym Satoshi Nakamoto verbrigt.Daher iher und öffentlich im Lieblingsforum von Satoshi Nakamoto, die Möglichkeit Fragen zu stellen. Fragen, die bisher eher durch die Bildung von Mythen auf eine Antwort warten? Fragen zu was auch immer? Auch zu den kommenden Projekten von Satoshi Nakamoto?Fragt!

comments.author: Zenp
comments.body: I’ll share with you this post from theymos in 2019 about nakamoto that I found very interesting. https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5092492.0It’s the hard work that Satoshi put in that’s made bitcoin such a success. I have no questions for him, I admire the hard working individual that satoshi was and hopefully is today.

comments.author: s5i-n6o
comments.body: Thank you very much for the tip. I didn't know the post. I have read through the whole thread at my leisure. As written, if you have questions, write them down here. Maybe Satoshi Nakamoto is reading and will write some answers.I would like to know the story that led to the idea of peer-to-peer currency?Does Satoshi Nakamoto like to eat pizza or hamburgers?These are just banal questions that I would ask him as a human being if I were sitting across from him.

comments.author: Cfntif
comments.body: Satoshi Nakamoto seems not to be a single person, but a team. As someone who does something similar. I know deeply that all this cannot be done by one person

comments.author: jeffhight
comments.body: It's fascinating how Satoshi Nakamoto's creation, Bitcoin, has indeed transformed the financial and technological landscape. The search for Satoshi's true identity continues to be a subject of great intrigue and speculation, as the impact of this pseudonymous innovator is undeniable. I have no questions for him, but I am very interested in how he looks. I imagine a thin, handsome man who spends 90% of his time at the computer

comments.author: hasitha lakshan
comments.body: Imagine that everyone knows satoshi nakamato, if that happens what will happen to the crypto market?

comments.author: s5i-n6o
comments.body: Quote from: jeffhight on September 27, 2023, 07:45:34 AMIt's fascinating how Satoshi Nakamoto's creation, Bitcoin, has indeed transformed the financial and technological landscape.It is a simple technology stack combined from different technological ideas of the end 90ies and beginning of e-Business / e-Commerce. The magic of implmentation lies in the fact that very close attention has been paid to the way analogue trade can be mapped in reality for the internet. And!How every trader who markets an analogue trade or service can participate in the value creation. In other words, it is not individual big players who decide what the price is for this or that, but the business partners who negotiate the price among themselves. [/quote]The idea here was much smaller than developing an entire industry out of it. Today, again, only whales share the BitCoins and others are allowed to put their money into a highly volatile investment.The original idea was that each person would run their own node on a normal computer. And thus is a participant in the wealth that is generated through this interaction. Even the seamstress in Bangladesh or the programmer in Bangalore would then be paid fairly via the network. By those who use their services.Quote from: jeffhight on September 27, 2023, 07:45:34 AMThe search for Satoshi's true identity continues to be a subject of great intrigue and speculation, as the impact of this pseudonymous innovator is undeniable.It is not important to stand on a pedestal in order to call an idea into the world. The decisive factor was that a few very good programmers then joined together in a collective and founded the network. All other cryptos today are derived from it.I am very sure that the idea had not been thought through to the end. And Saotshi Nakamoto will cause a stir with one or two more projects from the peer-to-peer stack. As a little birdie told me, there is still something to come. Stay tuned and enjoy.Quote from: jeffhight on September 27, 2023, 07:45:34 AMI have no questions for him, but I am very interested in how he looks.He looks like a normal person. You would pass him on the street. He is inconspicuous and sometimes modest. Quote from: jeffhight on September 27, 2023, 07:45:34 AMI imagine a thin, handsome man who spends 90% of his time at the computerSomtimes 98% and sometime 5%.

comments.author: s5i-n6o
comments.body: Quote from: hasitha lakshan on September 30, 2023, 06:45:54 AMImagine that everyone knows satoshi nakamato.You met him? ;-)Quote from: hasitha lakshan on September 30, 2023, 06:45:54 AM if that happens what will happen to the crypto market?The crypto market came after Satoshi Nakamoto. He had nothing more to do with it. It was, in the sense, the clear takeover of the network by speculating on the BitCoin.The aim is to tie up enormous amounts of money. This money is then not available for other projects and an inflation of the BitCoin through professional BitCoin mining causes an inflation. These are old rules of the financial market: bet on something that does not exist or that does not represent a real value, then this system or network will be destabilised and eliminated.What was not expected in this respect is that the #Zero node was never found. Thus, the network virtually maintains itself without collapsing. It thus becomes robust. However, if the idea is expanded into a network based on peer-to-peer, people can lose their money, just like in a real collapse in the capital market. The peer-to-peer currency is a much more exciting project about the backbone on which value creation can be tied. And not money on the capital market, which does not reflect any real value or real value creation.We very often forget that!

comments.author: rodskee
comments.body: don't worry , there will never be Satoshi that will answer your question here.

comments.author: s5i-n6o
comments.body: Quote from: rodskee on October 14, 2023, 09:27:39 AMdon't worry , there will never be Satoshi that will answer your question here.What makes you so sure? Satoshi Nakamoto is a mystery or a person who would not read here. So I think it's legitimate to ask questions.

comments.author: mich
comments.body: Well I do not think the person Satoshi Nakamoto is going to ever be coming back. There is people who want to pretend to be him just because of what he did for Bitcoin but your questions are not going to be answered by the real person.

comments.author: s5i-n6o
comments.body: Quote from: mich on October 15, 2023, 01:59:23 AMWell I do not think the person Satoshi Nakamoto is going to ever be coming back. There is people who want to pretend to be him just because of what he did for Bitcoin but your questions are not going to be answered by the real person. Think simple! I'm just asking what questions people who think they have vestenaded BitCoin are asking themselves. Yes, there were some people who called themselves Satoshi Nakamoto. At the end of the day, these people were focused on speculating on BitCoin. They manipulated the price of BitCoin upwards or downwards.And from today's perspective, no one has been able to reflect the real power of the peer-to-peer currency concept.I am interested in serious questions? And who knows if there won't be an adequate answer.So, be brave! And ask!

comments.author: s5i-n6o
comments.body: Many assume that Satoshi Nakamoto is an American! Why this assumption and where does this idea come from?

comments.author: kotajikikox
comments.body: Quote from: s5i-n6o on October 15, 2023, 12:37:45 PMMany assume that Satoshi Nakamoto is an American! Why this assumption and where does this idea come from?Am not sure when or where in this thread mentioned Satoshi as American ? Neither do i did not even think that satoshi is american or even from which country because there are no even once that satoshi admit that he is an american .but yeah  he might be or not? who must know right?

comments.author: Samlucky O
comments.body: Quote from: s5i-n6o on October 15, 2023, 12:37:45 PMMany assume that Satoshi Nakamoto is an American! Why this assumption and where does this idea come from?For me I don't really want to know where he came from, all am just concern is what he has created to help man kind. His legacy will never be forgotten in the history of mankind. He is really a genius and I respect him for that.

comments.author: btc78
comments.body: Quote from: s5i-n6o on October 15, 2023, 12:37:45 PMMany assume that Satoshi Nakamoto is an American! Why this assumption and where does this idea come from?many say this because he can communicate in perfect english but what does that have to do with anything? most americans can’t even speak english without being grammatically incorrect satoshi nakamoto is obviously a japanese name but a lot of people could have easily made this name up there’s really no way of knowing even where he is it’s hard to look for someone who doesn’t want to be found

comments.author: peter0425
comments.body: Quote from: s5i-n6o on October 15, 2023, 12:37:45 PMMany assume that Satoshi Nakamoto is an American! Why this assumption and where does this idea come from?Just like yours, it doesn't matter from where he live or from where he came from , because if he/she even wanted to hide His Identity so what more His origin right?isn't a great respect if we will show no interest about this part instead what he wanted for the whole world?and i wanted to put in my mind that he is for all nation as to what he brings in Humanity .Quote from: rodskee on October 14, 2023, 09:27:39 AMdon't worry , there will never be Satoshi that will answer your question here.Let Him wait all His Life if there will be any answer from our Great creator  , if not then its her lost not ours because we believe in Satoshi's legacy and not about whom he is or from where he came .

comments.author: bitterguy28
comments.body: how i wish that one day Satoshi will bring clarity to all our concern ..

comments.author: Jinx9975
comments.body: Satoshi Nakamoto not a person I think

comments.author: boyptc
comments.body: All valid questions even the nonsense ones will be remaining left unanswered. Satoshi is gone forever and he has left already his identity, his pseudonym because let us say that he is still alive now. He won't expose himself and go to public because he'd definitely be taken by the FEDs on an instant or someone's going to knock his door and he'll never know if they're from the government or private entities that are chasing after him. Well, even if we want to know him personally. If he's just there around roaming still on the forum he has started and founded, he'd definitely have a smile on his face while reading technical and non technical threads or just some random topics.
